revised_title: Meteorological Observations at Various Heights in India: A Study of Diurnal Tides and Atmospheric Pressure
tldr: The author presents meteorological observations taken at various heights in India, focusing on the diurnal tides and atmospheric pressure. The study examines the influence of elevation on the daily oscillation of the barometer and the amount of rainfall. Observations from Dodabetta, a location 8640 feet above sea level, are analyzed alongside other data to provide insights into the relationship between elevation and atmospheric phenomena.
